DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether the patient/participant has interstitial lung disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the personal medical history (an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced) of interstitial lung (the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place) disease (a disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ:One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Interstitial lung disease
ReferenceDocuments.description: Interstitial lung disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: No history of interstitial lung disease e.g. pneumonitis or pulmonary fibrosis or any evidence of interstitial lung disease on baseline chest CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic interstitial pneumonitis or is the patient asymptomatic with definitive evidence of interstitial pneumonitis described on CT scan, MRI, or chest x-ray?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of ongoing pneumonitis or significant interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis or other severe interstitial lung disease that requires oxygen therapy or is thought to require oxygen therapy within 1 year prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history or concurrent condition or interstitial lung disease of any severity and/or severely impaired lung function (as judged by the investigator)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.), or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computer tomography (CT) scan? (History of radiation pneumonitis in the radiation field (fibrosis) is permitted.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.), or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computer tomography (CT) scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of interstitial lung disease or interstitial fibrosis, including a history of pneumonitis, obliterative bronchiolitis, or pulmonary fibrosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active interstitial lung disease or have a history of pneumonitis for which they have received glucocorticoids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have current pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia (e.g., bronchiolitis obliterans), drug-induced pneumonitis, idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis or greater than or equal to grade 1 pulmonary fibrosis, per the CTCAE v5.0, on screening chest CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Patient has a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced pneumonitis, idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest CT scan
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced pneumonitis, idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.), or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computed tomography (CT) scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of interstitial lung disease including but not limited to sarcoidosis or pneumonitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), or organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.).

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), or organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.). History of radiation pneumonitis in a prior radiation field (fibrosis) is permitted.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pneumonitis or moderate-severe pre-existing pulmonary disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have interstitial lung disease or pulmonary fibrosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have interstitial lung disease or pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia (e.g., bronchiolitis obliterans), drug-induced pneumonitis, or idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis on chest CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of active interstitial pneumonitis or interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.), or active or recently active (within 90 days of randomization) pneumonitis (including drug induced) that required systemic immunosuppressive therapy (i.e. corticosteroids, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have interstitial lung disease with ongoing signs and symptoms at the time of registration?
